channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israeli Military Forces Patients and Staff to Leave Hospital in Northern Gaza
item.description: The hospital, Kamal Adwan, has been caught in the middle of Israel’s monthslong offensive against Hamas militants in northern Gaza.

item.title: EPA Promotes Fertilizer Carrying PFAS, Long After 3M Shared Risks
item.description: The agency obtained research from 3M in 2003 revealing that sewage sludge, the raw material for the fertilizer, carried toxic “forever chemicals.”

item.title: 10 Years After Obama’s Opening to Cuba, Despair Replaces Hope
item.description: A decade since the United States and Cuba restored diplomatic relations — which many believed would transform the island — Cuba is in its worst crisis...

item.title: These 3 stocks are soaring as the U.S. rushes to patch its electrical grid
item.description: Much of the grid was built over 50 years ago, and AI data centers are just one reason energy demand has skyrocketed.

item.title: ‘A one-man economy’ who no one dared oppose: Working for Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs before the billionaire’s arrest on sex-trafficking charges
item.description: We reached out to 100 former employees of Sean Combs. Here’s what those who agreed to share their memories say about working for the entertainment mog...

item.title: Elon Musk Needs to Teach Our Government How to Lose More Money
item.description: A better industrial policy for the United States involves more risk taking, not less.

item.title: Ukraine Slows Missile Fire Into Russia as Trump Prepares to Take Office
item.description: The long-range missiles provided by the United States and Britain were used to strike inside Russian territory, despite concerns that their use would ...

item.title: The Children Who Left Gaza
item.description: Sixteen young people evacuated from Gaza for treatment of dire injuries. Months later, they face new lives in an unfamiliar country.

item.title: What We Know About the Plane Crash in Kazakhstan
item.description: The Embraer 190 was traveling to Grozny, Russia, but crashed near Aktau, Kazakhstan, killing 38 people onboard. Investigators are focusing on Russian ...

item.title: A Month On, a Tenuous Cease-fire Holds Between Israel and Hezbollah
item.description: Israel and Hezbollah have exchanged strikes and accusations of breaches. Implementation of the deal has been slow. But the truce has brought some calm...

item.title: Trump’s MAGA base is clashing with Elon Musk’s ‘broligarchs’ over employer-tied visas that create ‘indentured servants’
item.description: The world's wealthiest tycoon wants more visas for engineering talent, but conservatives including RFK Jr. vice-presidential pick are savaging the H-1...

item.title: EPA Promotes Fertilizer Carrying PFAS, Long After 3M Shared Risks
item.description: The agency obtained research from 3M in 2003 revealing that sewage sludge, the raw material for the fertilizer, carried toxic “forever chemicals.”

item.title: How Revelry evolved from selling sorority gear out of the trunk of a car to building a $39 million wedding-wear empire
item.description: Michelle DeLoach has done something few brands have achieved: matching her customers’ journeys so much that her entire business focus changed.

item.title: Police say an Amazon driver ditched 80 packages in the woods before Christmas because they were ‘stressed’
item.description: “This is a human resources matter for Amazon,” Lakeville Police Chief Matthew Perkins said in a statement.

item.title: What We Know About the Ship Finland Seized Over Fears of Sabotage
item.description: Finland seized an oil tanker that authorities believe might have deliberately cut vital undersea cables. Finnish authorities believe the tanker may be...
